title: Coinbase Launches Derivatives Product in Crowded Market
summary: Coinbase just introduced a derivatives product, its latest attempt to move into a new field and offset weakness in its core spot-trading business. It has a lot of competition.

title: Tesla Vehicle Deliveries Tumble After China Factory Shutdown
summary: A string of record quarterly deliveries came to an end in the second quarter, when Tesla handed over 254,695 vehicles to customers.

title: Crypto’s Domino Effect Is Widening
byline: Caitlin Ostroff and Vicky Ge Huang
summary: Losses in the digital-assets industry are blowing holes in balance sheets and pushing firms to near bankruptcy.

title: Forget Flying Taxis—Down-to-Earth Companies Are Prime SPAC Targets
summary: With deal deadlines looming, industrial, manufacturing and other staid sectors have become more appealing for special-purpose acquisition companies.

title: Stocks Finish Higher to Kick Off New Quarter
summary: U.S. stocks advanced after Wall Street notched its worst first half of the year in more than half a century.

title: FTX Strikes Deal With Option to Buy Crypto Lender BlockFi for Up to $240 Million
summary: The accord with billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried’s crypto exchange also includes a $400 million revolving credit facility for BlockFi as crypto firms seek stability during a broad industry meltdown.

title: Risky Borrowers Largely Dodged Bankruptcy This Year. Now the Easy Money Is Ending.
summary: U.S. corporate defaults and bankruptcies stayed muted in the first five months of this year but market volatility, rising interest rates and a potential economic slowdown are making investors nervous about low-rated debt.

title: Wild First Half in Markets Sets Stage for More Big Moves
summary: Charts size up what might lie ahead for businesses and the economy.

title: EU Proposes Broad Cryptocurrency Rules
summary: Also: North Korea blames Covid-19 outbreak on virus-tainted balloons sent from South Korea. Russian prosecutors charge U.S. women’s basketball star Brittney Griner with intentionally importing drugs into the country. J.R. Whalen reports.

title: EU Sets First Rules to Regulate Cryptocurrencies
byline: Patricia Kowsmann, Caitlin Ostroff and Andrew Duehren
summary: European Union officials agreed on rules that would regulate the crypto market in the bloc, forcing platforms to seek authorization to operate and providing safeguards to users.

title: Markets Post Worst First Half of a Year in Decades
summary: Stocks, bonds and crypto all tumbled in the first six months of the year, with commodities markets including oil about the only place that didn’t lose ground.

title: Sotheby’s CEO on Why the Art Market Is Soaring
summary: From inflation to the rise of Asian collectors, Charles Stewart reveals the dynamics fueling robust auction sales.

title: Can Markets Bounce Back After a Grueling Six Months?
summary: Global markets have closed out their most bruising first half of a year in decades. Wall Street Journal markets reporter Akane Otani joins WSJ What’s News host Luke Vargas to explain that while history suggests the next six months could see a turnaround, investor sentiment remains pessimistic.

category: The Wall Street Journal Whats News
title: Can Markets Bounce Back After a Grueling Six Months?
summary: A.M. Edition for July 1. Global markets have closed out their most bruising first half of a year in decades. WSJ markets reporter Akane Otani explains that while history suggests the next six months could see a turnaround, investor sentiment remains pessimistic. Luke Vargas hosts.

title: North Korea Suspected of Plundering Crypto to Fund Weapons Programs
summary: A $100 million heist from crypto project Harmony matches tactics from a string of hacks linked to Pyongyang, blockchain experts say.

title: Most Countries Lack Crypto Information-Sharing Laws, Watchdog Says
summary: Only about 30% of jurisdictions surveyed said they had passed travel-rule legislation to help prevent illicit use of crypto

title: Markets Finish First Half of 2022 Sharply Lower
summary: Dow down 15.3% through the first half. S&P and Nasdaq each down more than  20%. Bitcoin value drops to around $19,000. J.R. Whalen reports.

title: ‘Cryptoqueen’ Is Now on FBI’s 10 Most Wanted List
summary: Ruja Ignatova, who allegedly operated a world-wide pyramid scheme through OneCoin, remains at large

title: S&P 500 Posts Worst First Half of Year Since 1970
summary: Bond yields and stocks fell at the end of a grueling first half and as investors considered updated readings on consumer spending and inflation.

title: SEC Rebuffs Grayscale on Turning Bitcoin Fund Into ETF
summary: The rejection of Grayscale Investments’ petition marks a fresh setback to the cryptocurrency industry.

title: Is DeFi the Next Revolution of the Internet Age?
summary: Discover how Cake DeFi is making crypto less complex.

title: Singapore Central Bank Reprimands Crypto Hedge Fund Three Arrows
summary: Singapore’s top financial regulator reprimanded cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital, saying it supplied false information to officials and managed more assets than allowed.

title: Celsius Said It Was Low Risk; Documents Show the Opposite
summary: Celsius, one of the largest crypto lenders, has been under pressure. And people active in the sector have been keeping a watchful eye. The lending giant promoted itself as lower risk but higher reward than traditional banks. But investor documents from last year show Celsius was actually built on risk. Wall Street Journal reporter Eliot Brown joins WSJ Tech News Briefing host Julie Chang to discuss the latest insights into Celsius’ business.

title: DeFi’s Existential Problem: It Only Lends Money to Itself
summary: Crypto lenders’ exclusive focus on other crypto projects suggests that their problems run much deeper than a Lehman-style liquidity crisis.

title: Behind the Celsius Sales Pitch Was a Crypto Firm Built on Risk
summary: Celsius CEO Alex Mashinsky built his cryptocurrency lender on a pitch that it was better than a bank. But investor documents show it had far more risk than a traditional lender.

title: Crypto’s Tumultuous Second Quarter Leaves Investors Asking: What Else Could Go Wrong?
summary: The crypto market lost more than half its value in the latest period.

category: The Wall Street Journal Tech Talk

summary: What’s News: Business & Finance

title: Crypto Hedge Fund Three Arrows Ordered to Liquidate by Court
byline: Serena Ng, Caitlin Ostroff and Vicky Ge Huang
summary: A British Virgin Islands court ordered the liquidation of the cryptocurrency hedge fund after creditors sued it for failure to repay debts.

title: Stocks Little Changed as Quarter’s End Nears
summary: U.S. stocks posted only slight moves as investors digested comments from central bankers and awaited quarterly earnings reports.

title: New York Finance Regulator Bullish on Crypto Despite Market’s Decline
summary: The head of the New York State Department of Financial Services said she wants the regulator to continue to be a leader in cryptocurrencies, remaining upbeat on virtual assets despite the industry’s turmoil.

title: Opinion: The U.S. Dollar Should Be More Like Bitcoin
summary: Stronger financial-privacy protections, faster payments and better transparency in monetary-policy governance.

title: What Happens If a Crypto Platform Goes Bankrupt?
summary: When cryptocurrency lending platform Celsius froze user accounts amid a plunge in valuations, it sent ripples across the industry and raised questions about what happens to user assets if a crypto platform files for bankruptcy. WSJ’s Vicky Ge Huang explains. Photo illustration: Jordan Kranse

title: NFT Artists Get First Major Test Since Crypto’s Collapse
summary: Last year Christie’s sold nearly $150 million worth of NFTs. This year? So far, it’s only sold $4.6 million in NFT art.

title: Opinion: ‘Irrational Exuberance’ on a Plate
summary: A bursting of the fake-burger bubble.

title: Do Kwon Tries Again After $40 Billion Crypto Crash
summary: Algorithmic stablecoin TerraUSD was supposed to maintain its value at $1 with the help of its sister-crypto, Luna. But TerraUSD’s price collapsed to pennies in May, while Luna plunged by more than 99%, wiping out around $40 billion in value. Their creator Do Kwon has been attempting a comeback by relaunching Luna. Wall Street Journal markets reporter Alexander Osipovich joins WSJ Tech News Briefing host Julie Chang to explain the collapse of Do Kwon’s crypto empire and what his second try looks like.

title: Hedge Funds Bet Against Tether, as Crypto Melts Down
summary: Short sellers have been ramping up their bets against tether, the world’s largest stablecoin, amid a broad market selloff that has called into doubt the financial health of some crypto companies. Wall Street Journal markets reporter Caitlin McCabe joins WSJ What’s News host Luke Vargas with more.

title: How Margin Calls Can Transform Market Downturns Into Market Crashes
summary: Investors rarely hear about margin calls except during market downturns. WSJ’s Dion Rabouin explains what they are and the unique way they are contributing to the current cryptocurrency crash. Illustration: Adele Morgan

category: The Wall Street Journal Whats News
title: Risk of Lockdowns in China Delays Return to Business as Usual
summary: A.M. Edition for June 28. The city of Shanghai may be emerging from a monthslong Covid-induced lockdown, but for companies across China, concerns about abrupt future lockdowns loom large. WSJ China corporate correspondent Liza Lin explains how a recent cycle of pandemic restrictions could complicate future business decisions and risk denting consumer activity. Luke Vargas hosts.

category: The Wall Street Journal Tech Talk
title: Do Kwon Tries Again After $40 Billion Crypto Crash
summary: Algorithmic stablecoin TerraUSD was supposed to maintain its value at $1 with the help of its sister-crypto, Luna. But TerraUSD’s price collapsed to pennies in May, while Luna plunged by more than 99%, wiping out around $40 billion in value. Their creator Do Kwon has been attempting a comeback by relaunching Luna. WSJ markets reporter Alexander Osipovich joins host Julie Chang to explain the collapse of Do Kwon’s crypto empire and what his second try looks like.

title: Robinhood Shares Soar on Takeover Hopes
byline: Vicky Ge Huang and Hannah Miao
summary: Robinhood Markets shares surged Monday on reports that cryptocurrency exchange FTX is exploring a potential acquisition of the brokerage.

title: Cake DeFi’s CEO Is on a Mission to Demystify Decentralized Finance
summary: Discover why DeFi could be the next great disruption.

title: Crypto Hedge Fund Three Arrows Defaulted on Loan, Says Broker
summary: Three Arrows has defaulted, failing to make loan payments tied to large bets in the digital-currency realm, crypto broker Voyager Digital said.

title: Studios Battle for Players of ‘Hypercasual’ Videogames, the Latest Mobile Distraction
summary: Mobile games that require little brainpower to play are becoming more sophisticated as their publishers try to cling on to fickle—and monetizable—players.

title: Marketers at NFT.NYC Upbeat on Brand-Building in the Metaverse
summary: Companies’ enthusiasm for the advertising potential of the virtual world was undimmed at NFT.NYC, a four-day event last week, in contrast to the recent downturn in cryptocurrencies and NFTs.

title: More Hedge Funds Bet Against Tether as Crypto Melts Down
summary: Short sellers have been ramping up their bets against tether, the world’s largest stablecoin, amid a broad market selloff that has called into doubt the financial health of some crypto companies.

category: The Wall Street Journal Tech Talk
title: VR Tech to Combat Social Isolation Among Seniors
summary: To tackle social isolation among seniors, some caregivers have turned to virtual reality. One company developing that technology is Rendever. At The Wall Street Journal's recent Future of Everything Festival, personal tech columnist Nicole Nguyen spoke with Rendever’s co-founder and CEO about where this tech stands today and how it can be leveraged to transform the day-to-day lives of residents in senior communities. Julie Chang hosts.

title: Dow Jumps as Rate-Hike Expectations Cool
summary: U.S. stock indexes moved more than 2% higher, as investors shifted their views about central bank policy after weak economic data.

title: Banks Face Risks From Geopolitics, Staff Turnover, OCC Says
summary: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency said geopolitical events, inflation and higher interest rates are posing headwinds for banks.

title: Celsius Network Taps More Advisers to Prepare for Potential Bankruptcy
summary: The crypto lending platform has hired restructuring consultants from Alvarez & Marsal to advise on a possible bankruptcy filing as it contends with the recent collapse in digital currencies.

title: Hackers Steal $100 Million Of Crypto From Harmony Blockchain Bridge
summary: Tech company Harmony says it is working to retrieve funds and identify who is behind the theft on one of its blockchain bridges

title: Low Bitcoin Price Weighs on Crypto Mining Stocks
summary: Worried about falling profits and high fixed costs, investors have been dumping  publicly traded bitcoin miners like Riot Blockchain and TeraWulf amid the cryptocurrency selloff.

title: ‘Buy the Dip’ Faith Has a Last Bastion: Individual Investors
summary: They remain big net buyers of stocks as professional money managers sell, but the scale of losses such investors are racking up could eventually lead them to capitulate.

title: What’s News: Business & Finance
summary: What’s News: Business & Finance

title: Dow, S&P 500 Inch Down After Powell Testifies to Congress
summary: Major indexes end slightly lower, while investors sought haven assets, after the Fed chairman discussed efforts to tame inflation.

title: Binance.US Eliminates Spot Trading Fees on Bitcoin
summary: The exchange’s users can trade bitcoin for the U.S. dollar, tether, other stablecoins without spot trading fees.

title: Stocks Edge Lower as Powell Acknowledges Economic Downturn Risk
summary: Also: Moderna shares rise 4.7% after saying its modified Covid-19 vaccine triggered immune responses against Omicron subvariants. Oil prices fall 2.5% to their lowest settlement level in a month. J.R. Whalen reports.

title: Opinion: Don’t Believe the Obits for Bitcoin
summary: Cryptocurrencies have faced constant volatility. It doesn’t matter for the ideologically committed.

title: Crypto Broker Says Three Arrows Capital Hasn’t Repaid $666 Million in Loans
summary: The broker says it could issue a notice of default against the crypto hedge fund.

title: Do Kwon’s Crypto Empire Fell in a $40 Billion Crash. He’s Got a New Coin for You.
byline: Alexander Osipovich in New York and Jiyoung Sohn in Seoul
summary: The South Korean entrepreneur’s cryptocurrency empire collapsed last month. Now, despite angry investors and government investigations, he is attempting a comeback.

title: Crypto Volatility: Your Questions Answered
summary: Crypto has been on a wild ride lately, experiencing huge dips and volatility impacting investors and companies, and catching the eye of regulators. Wall Street Journal crypto reporter Paul Vigna joins WSJ Tech News Briefing host Zoe Thomas to answer your questions about how the market is supposed to work, how the government is responding and what the future could hold for the cryptocurrency space.

title: Crypto Startup FalconX Raises $150 Million Despite Market Rout
summary: Funding for the trading platform geared toward institutional investors highlights investor support despite cryptocurrency market’s current financial tailspin.

title: A Perspective Spotlight With Stephen Tisdalle, State Street Global Advisors
summary: When faced with a challenge, who does Stephen Tisdalle, CMO of State Street Global Advisors, turn to for trusted advice?
